author: rudolf6
content:
Also just to clarify: we don't expect "block size" changing meaningfully compared to Merkle, ignoring the potential inclusion of the "execution witness" in the block. 

And for the "execution witness", it's possible/likely it will be propagated via a separate subnet (rather than in the block itself)

author: mempirate
content: Ah yes I was referring to the size of the witness! And wrt propagating it through a different subnet, what are the benefits here besides networking? Isn't the block+witness a single logical unit?

author: rudolf6
content:
Benefits are mostly around flexibility/upgradeability of the proof/witness in the future (e.g. changing the format without a hard fork, easier pruning of proofs/witnesses past a certain finalization point, not forcing all validators to have to "understand" proofs, etc).. the block+witness doesnt necessarily need to be a single logical unit.

author: jsign
content:
<@486477492434239488> , yeah, we've dedicated several calls before to the migration to describe the current plan "detailed enough" to have a POC (which we've in for geth) and looks performant enough for the data set we've used (whihc is a reduced dataset compared to mainnet).
So the current plan on that front is that Guillaume is working on a shadow fork so we can test the current implementation with a bigger database to do a more data-driven decision making on the current plan (if it's good enough, new bottlenecks, etc).
Also, it would be useful when more clients do the impl and see the performance on their side since there might be more custom bottlenecks (or not) depending on the client architecture.

At some point when the plan looks solid, we should definitely put the state migration mechanics as part of the spec... but for that we'd like to get first more data (from clients, from the shadow fork, etc) to solidify more the plan.

author: jsign
content: In the meantime we're touching in VIC calls other parts of the spec that need some definition (e.g: today we touched mostly on the BLOCKHASH situation for VKT, which is still an undecided and is also important to have a plan on that to not leave holes in the spec). So we're kind of trying to progress in as many directions as possible.
